title: Bug 6009: New class wizard doesn't set context correctly for nested classes
OB: When a .java file is open in the editor, and the user clicks the new class button, the 'Enclosing Type' field in the wizard is blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor when creating a nested class using the new class wizard.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a .java file in the editor. 
2. Click on the 'New Class' button. 
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the wizard.
